Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2012 01:17PM darnette wrote: HI HATETHIS, I AM SORRY TO READ ABOUT WHAT YOUR GOING THROUGH..CALM DOWN DON'T FREAK OUT.. THINK POSTIVE IT COULD BE NOTHING. I AM AHPPY YOUR GING TO SEE THE DOCTOR ABOUT IT THAT IS VERY IMPORTANT TO CHECK IT OUT AS EARLIEST AS POSSIBLE. I AM ONLY 34 AND I FOUGHT THE BATTLE THIS YEAR I DID CHEMO, SURGREY AND STARTING RADIATION TREATMENT MONDAY I AM READY TO GO ON WITH MY LIFE IT'S JUST A PROCESS. YOU HAVE TO BE READY TO FIGHT... WHATEVER THE SITUATION IS.. IF YOU CAN WALK AWAY FROM A MISERABLE 20 YEAR MARRIAGE THEN FIND HAPPINESS AGAIN WITH SOMEONE ELSE YOU CAN GET THROUGH ANYTHING THAT MEANS YOUR A STRONG WOMAN. YOUR NEW BOYFRIEND IF HE LOVES YOU HE WILL STAND BY YOU. YOU WILL NEED A STRONG SUPPORT SYSTEM.. YOUR IN MY PRAYS AND YOU STAY PRAYED UP..LET GO AND LET GOD HE WILL LEAD THE WAY.. HUGS TO YOU.

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2012 01:39AM darnette wrote: Hi Jenjenl, Just breath and Pray...We were all there before and you plan sounds like mine. I was 34 at the time I was diagnosed and all i could do in the dr. office was scream. I couldn't even cry because I was super in shock and after speaking with my dr. I knew everything was going to be alright. You have to have faith and trust.. I did chemo first to, and if your heathly and in good shape and have a strong mind you will be okay. I never got sick, I still worked and lived my life like I always have.. The downside of it all was losing my hair. But I cut my hair off before if could fall out. I stared wearing wig and changed them up often you have plkay with your new new self and love yourself from the inside out.. The people you share your BC with someone will come at you with some stupid response about chemo or anything you have the right to curse them out and leave them alone until after your comfortable talking.. The days you feel tired just relax listen to you body.. Believe me you will be fine...xoxoxoxoxo many hugs to you.... This is a lifestyle change for teh better u and new u..

Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2017 04:53PM darnette wrote: Hello Ladies, I haven't been up here in so long but now that I have to be I knew just where to go to get some information because I am so nervous. I been doing great for 5 years on tamoxphin now it's nor working and I have small spot on my breast bone. My doctor recommended me starting on ibance, fastlodex, Zoldex and the X-geva shot. I am so nervous because I don't know what to expect. I am fairly healthy not on any other medications. The Ibrance is suppose to come tomorrow morning so I guess I will take a pill with my dinner. I can't seem to sleep at night because all I can think about is this new medicine. I had zero side effects of the tamoxphin or Chemo other than the losing hair. Can someone please help a sister out and ease my mind. what I am grateful for that it's something we can take. I know everyone is different I am just praying that I can just continue to live a normal fun life while I can. I have an 8 years old and we are very active I would hate for that to stop. Thank You and I am praying everyday for us all.
